intro: Memora cristicalyx, commonly known as the starry bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It features showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue, often adorned with a distinctive star-like pattern on the petals. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender, hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Memora cristicalyx prefers well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight, making it a popular choice for garden cultivation.
